Nodes.NPCDialogue: Ah, I see. In this case make sure to mention the king's succession when you try to convince the gendarme chief to raise the militia. This ought to help you towards "Victory"...
Yes... yes! You might begin to see the truth then! We're not here to play games, perhaps there is a way to break the cycle, no?

"Victory" assumes there is also "defeat". However, why would anything ever defeat you? Life has so much more to offer than these small games. A clever man can win a game, an enlightened one would never lose. Which one do you wish to be?
Aah, but you see, what IS "victory". We must now figure this out shall we not?
I could explain, but you would never have the curiosity to understand what it is I would explain. You may sod off, and suffer what you will.
You insolent slave. This village shall be your very own cave, and your arrogance will chain you here forevermore. Do not talk to me again, you are incapable of learning.
Oh yes, good. One should not waste time in recognising their superiors now should they?
Hi, you are dumb, I am smart. You will henceforth obey me.

Edges.PlayerDialogue: How about you go fuck yourself?
Oh, and what shall I now do, my new master...
I am forever your inferior, oh great one, please, guide me towards victory.
What do you mean? Victory means winning.
A clever man, I have no pretentions towards being anything else.
I wish to be an enlightened man, I wish to rise above my material conditions.
I understand... thank you master, or should I say, teacher.
No, how about you shove it up yours, you fucking smartass.
What cave are you talking about, you madman?
